title.quote: Ex Post Conditions for the Exactness of Optimal Power Flow Conic Relaxations

extractions.description: This paper presents two equivalent ex post conditions for the exactness of any conic relaxation of the Optimal Power Flow (OPF) problem. These conditions act as exactness certificates for the computed solution, ensuring optimality even when traditional a priori exactness conditions are not met. Numerical examples using the MATPOWER library are provided to illustrate the use of these conditions.

type.justification: The paper primarily proposes theoretical conditions and proofs regarding conic relaxations in the Optimal Power Flow problem.
type.quote: In this short communication, we present two equivalent ex post conditions for the exactness of any conic relaxation of the OPF.

name.justification: The paper is focused on optimization problems related to power flow in electrical grids.
name.quote: Convex relaxations of the optimal power flow (OPF) problem provide an efficient alternative to solving the intractable alternating current (AC) optimal power flow.

name.justification: The context of the paper is within electrical power systems, specifically focusing on optimal power flow.
name.quote: The optimal power flow (OPF) problem consists of minimizing generation costs in an electric network while ensuring that all loads are adequately supplied and that the transmission physical constraints are met.

name.quote: Finally, we present numerical examples from the MATPOWER library where the ex post conditions hold even though the exactness sufficient conditions do not, thereby illustrating the use of the conditions.
